definitions.definition: quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences.
examples: the new method of protein detection was more sensitive than earlier ones
synonyms: vulnerable to; attuned to "she's sensitive to changes in temperature"

definitions.definition: easily damaged, injured, or distressed by slight changes.
examples: the committee called for improved protection of wildlife in environmentally sensitive areas

definitions.definition: (of photographic materials) prepared so as to respond rapidly to the action of light.
(of a market) unstable and liable to quick changes of price because of outside influences.
(of a person or a person's behavior) having or displaying a quick and delicate appreciation of others' feelings.
examples: I pay tribute to the Minister for his sensitive handling of the bill
I suppose I shouldn't be so sensitive
synonyms: neurotic; informaluptight "he's sensitive about his bald patch"

definitions.definition: kept secret or with restrictions on disclosure to avoid endangering security.
examples: he was suspected of passing sensitive information to other countries

definitions.definition: a person who is believed to respond to occult influences.
